newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada building permits rise 7.1 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: Canada building permits rise 7.1 pct in July.

text.p: The value of Canadian building permits issued in July rose 7.1 percent to C$2.40 billion from June, seasonally adjusted, Statistics Canada said Wednesday.
July Month pct chg Yr pct change
Economists surveyed by Reuters had forecast on average a month-on-month rise of 1.2 percent after June's 0.4 percent decline.
It was the third straight month that residential building permits saw a rise. "Lower mortgage rates and low prices have led to stronger demand for new homes," Statistics Canada said.
The demand was stronger in multi-family dwellings, for which permits rose 3.8 percent, than in single-family homes, which saw a 0.8 percent rise.
For the first seven months of 1996, the value of planned residential building construction was up 14.3 percent over the same period last year.
Building permits are an early indicator of future demand for labor and material by construction and contruction-related industries.
According to the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, about 95 percent of the residential building permits issued translate into actual housing starts.
